get.description: List access or ToR switches associations. If includeCandidates is true, the API will return all the possible associations with the specified aggregation or leaf switch in the specified fabric

1.description: List of all associated switches in the fabric

2.description: Specify the aggregationOrLeafSwitchId query parameter to get the association details of only the specified device. In this example, FDO29080SUT was specified.

3.description: Specify both aggregationOrLeafSwitchId and aggregationOrLeafPeerSwitchId query parameters to get associations for a VPC pair. In this example, FDO29080SUT and FDO29080N1A were specified.

4.description: Specify the accessOrTorSwitchId to get associations for that ToR switch. In this example, FDO29080BCN was specified.

5.description: If there are no associations for the specified switch or fabric, an empty array is returned.

6.description: Single access or ToR switch attached to single aggregation or leaf switch. Shows candidate associations with includeCandidates=true.

7.description: Single access or ToR switch attached to a VPC pair of aggregation or leaf switches. Aggregation or leaf switch(es) not paired with access or ToR switch. Shows candidate associations with includeCandidates=true.

8.description: A VPC pair of access or ToR switches attached to a VPC pair of aggregation or leaf switches. Aggregation or leaf switch(es) paired with access or ToR switch. Shows candidate associations with includeCandidates=true.

schema.description: Access or ToR switch inventory records

aggregationOrLeafPeerSwitchId.description: Serial number of the peer aggregation or leaf switch. Only returned when includeCandidates is true

aggregationOrLeafPeerSwitchName.description: Hostname of the peer aggregation or leaf switch. Only returned when includeCandidates is true

Retrieves scalable units and their switch assignments for an AI fabric.

**Two modes of operation:**
1. **All scalable units** (default): Returns all switches in the AI fabric organized by their scalable unit assignments
2. **Specific scalable unit**: When `scalableUnit` query parameter is provided, returns switches for that specific scalable unit only

Returns switches with serial numbers and descriptions. When getting all scalable units, optionally includes an "unassigned" group for switches not assigned to any scalable unit.

parameters.description: Get switches for a specific scalable unit only. If omitted, returns all scalable units with their assignments
parameters.name: scalableUnit

parameters.description: Include switches not assigned to any scalable unit (only applicable when scalableUnit parameter is not provided)
parameters.name: includeUnassigned

allScalableUnits.summary: All scalable units with their switch assignments

emptyUnassignedBucket.summary: Response with includeUnassigned=true but no unassigned switches

get.description:
Retrieves server information across all AI fabrics in the system with optional filtering, pagination, and sorting.

Each server object contains associated fabric name, scalable unit, AI cluster, interfaces and other details.

By default, returns full server objects with complete details (serverData schema).
Use the `summary=true` parameter to get a reduced subset with essential information only.

**When summary=true, only these 9 fields are returned:**
- serverName, chassisId, fabricName, scalableUnitName, aiClusterName
- serverDescription, operationalStatus, managementIpv4Address, managementIpv6Address


**Filterable Attributes:**
- serverName: Name of the server
- fabricName: Name of the fabric containing the server
- scalableUnitName: Name of the scalable unit containing the server
- aiClusterName: Name of the AI cluster containing the server

**Lucene Filter Examples:**
- `fabricName:AI_Fabric_East` - Get servers from specific fabric
- `scalableUnitName:scalable-unit-1` - Get servers from specific scalable unit
- `serverName:gpu-server-01` - Get specific server by name
- `aiClusterName:East_Coast_Cluster` - Get servers from specific AI cluster
- `fabricName:AI_Fabric_East AND scalableUnitName:scalable-unit-1` - Combine filters
- `serverName:gpu-server-*` - Wildcard matching for server names

parameters.description:
When set to `true`, returns essential server summary data only (9 fields listed above).
When omitted or `false`, returns full server objects with complete details.
parameters.name: summary

schema.description: Response containing server data

results.description: List of server data. Returns full server objects by default, or filtered summary when summary=true

templateContentType.description:
Content type of the configuration template
The enum referenced here might use a different case format compared to the actual value used in the template content
Please consult the config template documentation for more details

parameterType.description:
The followings are the available parameter types:
boolean: Valid values are true or false; not iterative.
enum: Example values like running-config, startup-config; not iterative.
long: Example 100; not iterative.
float: Floating number format; not iterative.
floatRange: Example values like 10.1,50.01; iterative.
Integer: Any number; not iterative.
integerRange: Contiguous numbers separated by - or discrete numbers separated by , (e.g., 1-10,15,18,20); iterative.
interface: Format is <if type><slot>[/<sub slot>]/<port>, e.g., eth1/1, fa10/1/2; not iterative.
interfaceRange: Example values like eth10/1/20-25, eth11/1-5; iterative.
ipAddress: IPv4 or IPv6 address; not iterative.
ipAddressList: List of IPv4, IPv6, or combination addresses; iterative.
ipAddressWithoutPrefix: Example 192.168.1.1 or 1:2:3:4:5:6:7:8; not iterative.
ipV4Address: IPv4 address; not iterative.
ipV4AddressWithSubnet: Example 192.168.1.1/24; not iterative.
ipV6Address: IPv6 address; not iterative.
ipV6AddressWithPrefix: Example 1:2:3:4:5:6:7:8 22; not iterative.
ipV6AddressWithSubnet: IPv6 address with subnet; not iterative.
ISISNetAddress: Example 49.0001.00a0.c96b.c490.00; not iterative.
macAddress: 14 or 17 character length MAC address format; not iterative.
string: Free text, e.g., description of a variable; not iterative.
string[]: Array of strings, e.g., {a,b,c,str1,str2}; iterative.
struct: Set of parameters bundled under a single variable; can be iterative if declared as an array.

vrfLiteAutoConfig.description: VRF Lite Inter-Fabric Connection Deployment Options. If 'back2BackAndToExternal' is selected, VRF Lite IFCs are auto created between border devices of two Easy Fabrics, and between border devices in Easy Fabric and edge routers in External Fabric. The IP address is taken from the 'VRF Lite Subnet IP Range' pool.

ibgpPeerTemplate.description: Specifies the iBGP Peer-Template config used for Route Reflectors and spines with border or border gateway role. This field should begin with '  template peer' or '  template peer-session'. This must have 2 leading spaces. Note ! All configs should strictly match show run output, with respect to case and newlines. Any mismatches will yield unexpected diffs during deploy.

leafIbgpPeerTemplate.description: Specifies the config used for leaf, border or border gateway.  If this field is empty, the peer template defined in iBGP Peer-Template Config is used on all BGP enabled devices (RRs, leafs, border or border gateway roles).  This field should begin with '  template peer' or '  template peer-session'. This must have 2 leading spaces. Note ! All configs should strictly match 'show run' output, with respect to case and newlines. Any mismatches will yield unexpected diffs during deploy.

securityGroupSelector.description: Base schema for security group selector

type.description: Security group selector type. It can be one of the following: connectedEndpoint, externalSubnet, network, networkPort, vm.

securityGroup.description: Security Group which is defined by an id and a name. It also includes the list of IP, Network, Network Port and VM selectors.

attach.description: Indicates whether a security group is attached or detached. If attached, the security group intent will be generated for the included selectors. When a security group is attached, the related contract associations that are in detached state will not be attached implicitly. If detached, the security group intent that is present will be negated for the fabric.

vrfNames.description:
List of VRF names referenced by this security group and the security associations it is part of.
The VRF names control the scope of the security group selectors and the security associations that use this security group.
Only selectors belonging to the VRFs in this list will be accepted for this security group.
Security group can only be part of security associations bound by these VRF names.
To support backwards compatibility, if no VRF names were provided, the VRF name will show up as "default" 
and this security group is not allowed to be part of any security associations or have any selectors until at least one VRF name is added.

contractName.description: Security contract name. The name is case insensitive.  This field is not editable during update.  Max length of contract name is 63 characters when tenant is default, while fully qualified name is 92 characters when using non default tenant.

contractDirection.description:
Contract direction is a first class attribute of a contract.
It can be either bidirectional, unidirectional or custom (direction defined per rule).
Custom is needed for backwards compatibility to support existing contracts with mixed direction rules.
Custom is allowed only for contracts on default tenant.

direction.description:
Security contract rule direction. It can be either bidirectional or unidirectional.
It derives its value from the parent contract unless the parent contract direction is custom.
In that case, the direction must be specified per rule.

protocolDefinitionName.description: Security protocol definition name.  The name is case insensitive. This field is not editable during update.  Max length of protocol definition is 63 characters when tenant is default, while fully qualified name is 92 characters when using non default tenant.

protocolDefinitionMatchSummary.description: Security protocol definition match criteria summary

protocolDefinitionMatchName.description: Security protocol definition match entry name. This field is not editable during update.

protocolDefinitionMatchCriteria.description: Schema for security protocol definition match criteria

protocolOptions.description: Match protocol option i.e. protocol label and/or number

srcPortRange.description: Match source port range in the format <from>-<to>

dstPortRange.description: Match destination port range in the format <from>-<to>

securityProtocolDefinition.description: Schema for security protocol definition. This includes the protocol definition name and the match criteria.

securityAssociationName.description: Security association name. The name is case sensitive. This field is not editable during update.

srcVrfName.description:
Source VRF name. This is optional and if not provided, it will be derived from the source security group.
If provided, the source VRF must match with one in the source security group's VRF names.

dstVrfName.description:
Destination VRF name. This is optional and if not provided, it will be derived from the destination security group.
If provided, the destination VRF must match with one in the destination security group's VRF names

attach.description: Indicates whether a security association is attached or detached. If attached, the security association intent will be generated for the fabric. When a security association is attached, the related contract associations that are in detached state will not be attached implicitly. If detached, the security association intent that is present will be negated for the fabric.

interfaceBandwidth.description: Configure the bandwidth value for this interface.

interfaceErrorDetectionAcl.description: Enable error detection for access-list installation failures.

interfaceFec.description: Specifies the forward error correction (FEC) mode for the interface. Use 'auto' for automatic FEC selection, 'fcFec' for CL74 (25/50G), 'off' to disable FEC, 'rsCons16' for RS FEC Consortium 1.6 (25G), 'rsFec' for CL91 (100G) or Consortium 1.5 (25/50G), and 'rsIEEE' for RS FEC IEEE (25G).

interfaceLinkType.description: Specify a link type for spanning tree protocol use.

interfaceQueuingPolicy.description: Queuing policy must be defined previously.

interfaceStormControl.description: Configure storm control on this interface.

interfaceStormControlBroadcastLevel.description: Set broadcast traffic storm control level in percentage.

interfaceBpduFilter.description: Configure spanning-tree bpdu filter. Default means 'return to default settings'.

interfacePVlan.description: It is a networking feature, primarily implemented on Layer 2 switches, that provides enhanced isolation for ports within a single traditional VLAN.

interfaceSVlan.description: Secondary VLANs are used to define specific isolation rules for ports within that primary VLAN, enabling more granular control over Layer 2 communication.

interfacePvlanAllowedVlans.description: Allowed values are 'none', or vlan ranges (e.g. 1-200,500-2000,3000).

interfacePvlanMode.description: Allows for isolation of ports within a single VLAN by using private VLAN modes.

interfacePvlanNativeVlan.description: Refers to the Native VLAN that is configured on a promiscuous port within a Private VLAN (PVLAN) domain.

interfacePrefix.description: Netmask length for the IP address, minimum is 1 and maximum is 31.

prefix.description: Subnet mask length, minimum is 4 and maximum is 32.

interfaceDot1qTunnel.description: It allows for flexible configuration where the outer S-VLAN tag applied to an incoming frame depends on the frame's original inner C-VLAN tag.

interfaceCustomerInnerVlanId.description: The Customer Inner VLAN is the customer's original VLAN tag, which is preserved and transported (often by being "stacked" within an outer Service VLAN tag) across a service provider's network to maintain the customer's internal network segmentation.

vrfName.description: For firewall, load balancer, VNF and other cluster types in one arm mode, this field represents the service VRF. For firewall in two arm mode, this field represents the outside VRF. For load balancer, VNF and other cluster types in two arm mode, this field represents the first arm VRF. For firewall in N arms mode, this field represents the outside VRF. For load balancer, VNF and other cluster types in N arms mode, this field represents the first arm VRF. For default gateway in N arms mode, this field represents the outside VRF.

addSeparator.description:
Add visual separator before this DELETE configuration line in the UI for grouping and selection during reconciliation.

Set to true for:
- Single-line global config DELETE (e.g., feature commands)
- Parent DELETE starting a new configuration block
- Child DELETE when parent is not being deleted

Set to false for:
- Child DELETE when parent is also being deleted
- All INSERT operations
- All EQUAL operations
